alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 10 at 3:48PM MDT until October 13 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Generally 6 to 12 inches expected above 8,000 feet. Totals around 18 inches across the highest terrain. * WHERE...Absaroka Mountains and Wind River Mountains East. The heaviest snow is expected in the southern Absaroka range. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hunters and others heading into the backcountry should prepare for wet and cold conditions. Heavy, wet snow could make for difficult travel on unpaved mountain roads, especially above 8,000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Wind River Mountains East
